title: accesstk
author: accesstk
content: Hi everyone！Which sites do you go to everyday for general crypto information and news?？I visit Cointelegraph.com and coincu.com.Please let me know which site you visit often.What do you recommend?Cheers

comments.author: Charles-Tim
comments.body: You can also try Coindesk. On Coingecko or Coinmarketcap, go to explore to see news from different sites. On Unstoppable wallet, go to market (the first icon at the lower left side) and click on news to see news from different sites.

comments.author: pakhitheboss
comments.body: I know there are multiple websites like cointelegraph, cryptopotato, coindesk and others where you can find news related to the industry. I follow multiple channels on YouTube, Instagram and website to gather information related to cryptocurrency. Other than these channels I follow Bitcoin discussion board, Beginners & help board and Altcoin discussion board to stay in touch with the current affairs.

comments.author: Hatchy
comments.body: If you're looking for reliable sources for crypto updates, I'd recommend checking out CoinMarketCap. It's a trustworthy platform known for its comprehensive cryptocurrency market data and news. Additionally https://bitcoinmagazine.com/, is another great resource. It's versatile and provides insightful coverage of various aspects within the cryptocurrency space, much like CoinMarketCap. These two options should offer you a broad view of the latest in the crypto world.

comments.body: Bitcoin news websitesI barely read news but if I read, I will choose Bitcointalk.org, Coindesk.com, Bitcoinmagazine.com and Bitcoinist.com. All websites are in that topic but I recommend you to read as least news as possible. The world does not stop spinning, cryptocurrency does not stop if you don't cryptocurrency news.The more news you read, the more psychological effects you have.

comments.author: Yamane_Keto

There is a section for Bitcoin in many news and economic sites  obtaining Bitcoin news as a package of your daily economic news has become easy and from sources that can be Trust it, especially if you have experience with stock marketNews services are not a good place to make decisions about investing in altcoins.Bitcoin.com is bad one they misleading Bitcoin as BCH

comments.author: Obari
comments.body: Sincerely I spend more time on the forum then on any other site and almost all my informations are from the forum because any information passed also has a link to the original post but all the same I already have my area of focus and I think in other for me to avoid getting unnecessary messages, or false informations, I prefer to stick to the forum and sometimes qoura for almost all news and information regarding cryptocurrency.From my personal observations and experience, I think the forum is already a safe space to get cryptocurrency news and I think people should at least stick to a Patrick post lace for information and avoid jumping around.

comments.author: oktana
comments.body: When it comes to cryptocurrency information (like info about a token/coin), I use CoinGecko and CoinMarketCap just the same. But when it comes to news, I use CoinDesk. However, there are many more reputable and popular websites you can check too.CryptoSlate (cryptoslate.com) -> offers news, reviews, and research on various cryptocurrencies and blockchain projects.The Block (theblockcrypto.com) -> is known for its investigative journalism on the crypto and blockchain space.Decrypt (decrypt.co) -> Decrypt is also for news, features, and guides.CryptoCompare (cryptocompare.com) -> real-time cryptocurrency prices, news, and analysis.Additionally, platforms like Reddit and Twitter can also be a good resource for the latest news.

comments.author: Zlantann
comments.body: Quote from: accesstk on November 01, 2023, 12:44:12 PMHi everyone！Which sites do you go to everyday for general crypto information and news?？I visit Cointelegraph.com and coincu.com.Please let me know which site you visit often.What do you recommend?CheersVerify all the information you get on any website. You can verify by checking other websites concerning the information you are interested in. It is not enough to read news from these online news channels you have to also know the sources of the information. Some of these news outlets can be an instrument to spread FUD. The ideal source of information for government policy is the website of such state agencies. If you want to get information about Bitcoin ETF the most reliable source will be the SEC media platforms. We all knew how fake news about the ETF was circulated by a well-known media house. Nevertheless, my main source of information is bitcointalk.org because you can verify the reliability of any news in this forum. Members are good at analyzing the validity of the news to ascertain if it is true or fake. For YouTube videos, I recommend Andreas M. Antonopoulos.
